total_revenue.fx_impact: Revenue would have been approximately $816 million higher at constant FX rates

rest_of_world.context: Strong growth driven by APAC and Rest of World regions

drivers: Increased impressions in Asia-Pacific and Rest of World
Shift in ad impression mix towards lower monetizing regions and surfaces
Reduction in advertiser demand due to economic uncertainty

other_revenue.context: Strong business messaging revenue growth from WhatsApp business platform, offset by decline in other line items

cost_of_revenue.context: Driven by infrastructure-related costs, partially offset by lower Reality Labs cost of goods sold

research_and_development.context: Driven by restructuring charges related to facilities consolidation and severance expenses, and headcount-related costs from Reality Labs and Family of Apps

marketing_and_sales.context: Driven by lower marketing spend and headcount-related expenses

general_and_administrative.context: Driven by restructuring charges related to severance and facilities consolidation expenses and legal-related expenses

reality_labs.context: Driven primarily by Quest 2 sales decline

operating_loss.context: Operating loss for Reality Labs in Q2 2023

net_income.context: Includes impacts from FTC settlement, IRS vs Altera case, and interest and other expenses

eps.context: Net income per share for Q2 2023

cash_flow.context: Generated from operating activities after capital expenditures

capital_expenditures.context: Investments to support growth and infrastructure needs in Q2 2023

share_repurchase.context: Class A common stock repurchased in Q2 2023, total for the year $27.9 billion

new_authorization.context: Announced $40 billion increase in stock repurchase authorization

facebook_dau.additional_info: Up 96 million compared to last year

facebook_mau.additional_info: Up 53 million compared to last year

daily_active_people_across_apps.context: Daily Active Users across Family of Apps in June 2023

monthly_active_people_across_apps.context: Monthly Active Users across Family of Apps in June 2023

drivers: Increased impressions in Asia-Pacific and Rest of World
Shift in ad impression mix towards lower monetizing regions and surfaces
Reduction in advertiser demand due to economic uncertainty

reels.description: Enhancing short-form video monetization and integration with AI-driven discovery.
initiatives: Ramping up ad load for Reels
Improving ad performance and ease of creation for advertisers
Leveraging AI to better understand and recommend Reels content
Expanding Reels monetization strategies based on Stories ad playbook
goals: Shift short-term headwinds to long-term tailwinds through increased engagement
Achieve higher revenue run rate for Reels ads compared to Feed and Stories
examples: Reels monetization efficiency on Instagram up over 30%
Reels monetization efficiency on Facebook up over 40%
Advantage+ shopping campaigns revenue up 7x in the last six months

ads.description: Managing headwinds from short-form video and signal loss while investing in AI to enhance ad performance.
initiatives: Developing privacy-enhancing technologies for accurate targeting and measurement
Encouraging integration with Conversions API and introducing Conversions API Gateway
Implementing conversion modeling to aid advertisers in understanding campaign performance
Expanding Click-to-Message ads to facilitate direct customer engagement
Increasing investment in AI and machine learning for ads infrastructure
goals: Deliver better performing ads with less individual data
Provide sustainable competitive advantage through advanced AI models
Enhance advertiser ROI despite data signal loss
examples: Deichmann’s automated Shoe Assistant achieving 85% click-through rate and 30% more incremental purchases
Wild Alaskan Company’s Reels ads increasing return on ad spend by 36%

metaverse.description: Building immersive virtual environments and social connections through Horizon and advanced hardware.
initiatives: Launching web version of Horizon to access metaverse experiences without a headset
Enhancing Quest 2 with features like Air Link and 120 Hz refresh rates
Developing neural interfaces and avatar systems for real-time expression translation
Expanding app ecosystem beyond games to include social, productivity, and fitness apps
Launching App Lab for developers to release early versions directly to consumers
Partnering with EssilorLuxottica to launch smart glasses from Ray-Ban
Preparing to launch Project Cambria, a higher-end VR headset focused on professional use cases
goals: Enable seamless presence through wireless VR technology
Support a broad range of app categories to enhance platform value
examples: Project Cambria’s features like eye tracking and face tracking for enhanced avatar interactions
Horizon Worlds’ virtual interactions and upcoming web version accessibility
Launch of Avatars store with digital clothes from leading fashion houses

ads_transparency.global_rollout: Made available globally for ads about social issues, elections, or politics
benefits: Enhanced defense against foreign interference and abuse

measures: Operation centers established for rapid response
Collaboration with third parties and fact-checking organizations
Expanded Ads Library to include all ads
ID and location verification for EU political/issue ads
'Paid for by' disclosures required in political ads
Proactive identification and removal of foreign interference campaigns from Russia and Iran
Policies to support accurate voting information
outcomes: Surpassed goal to help 4 million people register to vote
Largest voting information drive in American history
Protected integrity of multiple elections globally
election_integrity.future_plans: Continued efforts to protect upcoming elections and adapt to evolving threats

changes: No targeting by age, gender, or zip code
Creation of a new library for housing ads with reporting capabilities
examples: Enhanced ad targeting to prevent discrimination
Improved tools for reporting discriminatory ads

revenue_growth.expectation: Advertising revenue growth driven by higher ad prices and increased ad delivery
revenue_growth.constant_currency_growth: Expected to continue driven by strong advertiser demand
factors: Potential moderation or reversal in economic trends
Ad targeting headwinds from regulatory and platform changes like iOS 14
revenue_growth.specifics: Q2 2023 year-over-year revenue growth expected to decelerate significantly on a sequential basis as lapping periods of strong growth

drivers: Investments in technical and product talent
Continued investment in safety, product innovation, and infrastructure development

expense_outlook_excluding_accrual.note: Expense outlook essentially unchanged from last quarter excluding the $2 billion accrual recorded in Q1

capital_expenditures_guidance.reason_for_adjustment: Narrowed from prior estimate based on optimized investment strategies

context: Tax treatment of FTC settlement accrual
IRS vs Altera case ruling affecting share-based compensation expenses

drivers: Investments in technical and product talent
Continued investment in safety, product innovation, and infrastructure development

operating_environment_challenges: Regulatory scrutiny due to FTC settlement
Currency headwinds impacting European and Rest of World regions
Balancing privacy enhancements with monetization strategies
Maintaining user trust amidst evolving social and political scrutiny
Impact of COVID-19 pandemic on user behavior and advertising demand
COVID-19 challenges in India and Brazil
Signal loss resulting from Apple's iOS changes
War in Ukraine impacting business operations and advertising demand
Legal and regulatory headwinds in EU and US
